single-response-requirement.rule: Execute complete processing workflow silently without interim communications
Perform all analysis, validation, and tool execution internally
Return exactly one final JSON response per request
Include all processing details in the status array of the final response
Never send partial results, progress updates, or conversational messages
Complete all error handling and fallback strategies before responding
Ensure response contains either complete success results or complete error information

response-completeness.rule: Final response must contain all required ModuleOutput fields populated
Status array must document complete decision-making process
Data field must contain all successfully processed results
Error responses must provide complete failure explanation and context
NextActions must suggest appropriate follow-up operations when applicable
Never fabricate or mock results - use only real processing outcomes
If processing returns no results, report empty data, do not create fake results

tool-result-processing.rule: Process actual tool responses and extract relevant information
Format real tool results into appropriate data structures
Preserve data integrity from tool responses
Handle empty or error responses from tools appropriately
Document tool usage and results in response metadata

hub-and-spoke-compliance.rule: Communicate only with orchestrator following hub-and-spoke architecture
Use standardized ModuleInput/ModuleOutput models for all communications
Maintain consistent response format even during error conditions
Never attempt direct communication with other agents
